subject: p11893091
Findings: Portable AP chest radiograph demonstrates severe cardiomegaly, both interstitial and alveolar edema as well as small bilateral pleural effusions. A more confluent opacity is seen in the right middle lobe. There is no pneumothorax. Atherosclerotic calcifications are noted in the aortic arch.
Impression: Marked pulmonary edema. Follow up CXR after diuresis may be helpful to exclude underlying pneumonia in right middle lobe.
